battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-10-31..title: Battle Rhythm 2025-10-31
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-10-31..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-10-31..description:
What do I mean by Battle Rhythm? It‚Äôs a term SSG Andrade uses, and it refers to the communication strategy a leader uses to keep everyone synced. Open enrollment period for the Affordable Care Act (ACA) marketplace is NOW until 31JAN2025 Unit training and activations are hazardous. Health insurance is a requirement to work full-time for a Rattlesnake hand crew. Enroll here: https://www.coveredca.com Hard deadline is 19OCT2025 ‚ö†Ô∏è Same time as 15-19DEC2025 "stand down" Instructions were emailed to your @cmd.ca.gov with title Fw: JKO courses ‚òëÔ∏è Task: Reply per instructions in email Reach out with questions Next drill is 14-16NOV. You are likely out of time to submit a Form 1003.
Mandatory ‚Äústand down‚Äù is 15-19DEC at Camp San Luis Obispo. You will receive ESAD Pay If you lost access to @cmd.ca.gov or @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov accounts, notify myself or ASL. Regards, SPC Shoemaker, George

battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-11-07..title: Battle Rhythm 2025-11-07
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-11-07..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-11-07..description:
Please read carefully. There's one explicit task in here. Otherwise have a great weekend guys!Through the grapevine: FTX will be land navigation. Bring a compass if you have it üß≠üó∫Ô∏è VIPER is a "PowerApp" set up by Chief Zollo to track issued gear / trainings / personnel status You will use it by 19DEC to upload your JKO trainings as PDFs. ‚òëÔ∏è TASK: Show me if you have VIPER access or not by Sunday 08NOV @ 1159 Open VIPER App Launches browser or SharePoint app if you have it. Either is fine. Log in with your @cmd.ca.gov credentials Take a screenshot of whatever you see and direct message it to me on Signal
For example, this is what I see after I log in. Send me a screenshot of whatever you see after attempting to log in. Expectation for Signal is to reply within 24h. If you don't I will task someone out to track you down. Giving a message a üëç = "Received and understood." If you don't understand, ask the ASL or myself and we will help you. Respond to high-level leaders (such as officers) ASAP if they reach out to you directly. üí°Good idea to check your @cmd.ca.gov inbox regularly, that is where they tend to do it Please use the email format you demonstrated last weekend for formal emails.
I added to the Email Accounts Explained page, namely: KEY POINTS Troubleshooting REQUIRED Printed Accession Orders + Drill Orders (not cut yet unfortunately) Complete OCP uniform + nametapes / patches / rank insignia Summer PTs (short sleeve shirt and shorts) + Winter PTs (jacket and pants) Bedding, toiletries (razor!), socks and underwear, shower shoes + towel Notebook + blue & black pen Water bottles (at least 2L total, disposable is fine) STRONGLY SUGGESTED IRPG Pad lock for your foot locker Wrist watch (cheap black Casio is perfect) Coyote brown hydration pack + bladder Compass for land nav FTX Questions? Please ask. We are 1 week out from drill, 14-16NOV. Arrival window at Camp San Luis Obispo is 1830-2100 PFC Moran will be acting SL at drill. I will be covering down at the San Jose crew.
Drill orders are not cut yet but should be soon. Have a plan to print them. GoCSG > Dashboard > Orders
Mandatory ‚Äústand down‚Äù is 15-19DEC at Camp San Luis Obispo. You will receive ESAD Pay JKO trainings are due 19DEC 30NOV, uploaded to VIPER as PDFs. If you lost access to @cmd.ca.gov or @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov accounts, notify myself or ASL. Regards, SPC Shoemaker

battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-11-21..title: Battle Rhythm 2025-11-21
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-11-21..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-11-21..description:
Complete by 1159 23NOV**JKO site is down thru Sunday 23NOV, this task is impossible
Complete the Sexual Assault Prevention and Response (SAPR) course Go to the JKO courses email in your @cmd.ca.gov inbox for details Reply to my email sent to your @cmd.ca.gov with a PDF attachment of your SAPR certificate Email title is Task: SAPR
DO NOT send me a screenshot. PDF. This is coming straight from the PSG, SSG Andrade
FRAGO: Stand down dates are now 15-*18DEC
FRAGO: JKO Trainings are now due by 30NOV2025 ergo the task for next week will be to complete & submit all your JKO trainings (per email instructions)
Start now. Have you not yet gone to BOC / BTC? Basic Orientation Course enrollment will be open 05DEC-31DEC
Next BOC will be sometime in January
If you haven't gone yet, you will go JAN2025 Drill aka Annual Muster You will arrive NLT 1500 on 23JAN You might get told to arrive sooner. Standby. At Muster expect to Do a lot of paperwork
Do a PT test
Get taped by a medical professional
**If you don't meet height / weight standards you are ineligible to fight fire. Expect to receive a 6 month weight-loss target. If you don't lose the weight, you're out. Possible military ball? Standby. Next 1C Academy is 13-23JAN There is an application process, I will roll out details / prerequisite online courses.
I expect everyone who is not 1C certified to apply. Firefighting is the purpose of the Unit.

headers.heading: ‚òëÔ∏è TASK  (can't be completed at this time)

battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-12-06..title: Battle Rhythm 2025-12-06
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-12-06..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-12-06..description:
Not much new information if you've been keeping up on Signal... Expect orders to get published soon on GoCSG CHANGE: Orders were emailed to your @cmd innobx What does the schedule look like? It's a lot of death by PowerPoint. You will arrive 15DEC2025 NLT 1600 Do not screw this up. Arrive early. You are on paid orders. ‚òëÔ∏è TASK : Acquire a lock for your foot locker by 15DEC We will be in barracks There will be National Guardsmen around Do not give them an opportunity to mess with your unsecured items. I have filed away your completed trainings here If you have VIPER access, remember to only upload PDFs (no images) If you don't, sorry. I'll keep trying.
‚òëÔ∏è TASK : Please log in to GoCSG now to maintain access since last drill Log in every <29 days or you will lose access to your @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov account

battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-12-12..title: Battle Rhythm 2025-12-12
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-12-12..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2025-12-12..description:
Docs for Stand Down üîí Agenda
üîí CONOP
üîí Itinerary + QA Expect to show Orders & ID at the gate per usual Accountability: Send your ETAs to the squad chat per usual You will arrive 15DEC2025 NLT 1600 @ CSLO You will arrive 15DEC2025 NLT 1400 @ CSLO Upon arrival, check in at Bldg 621 Plan is for 3rd PLT to form up in front of Bldg 621 for accountability by 1400 ‚òëÔ∏è TASK: Print your stand down orders (emailed to your @cmd inbox) ‚òëÔ∏è TASK: Print you SHP training cert
Your SHP training cert is archived here Required: printed stand down orders + SHP training cert complete OCP uniform (insignia, patches, name tapes) + coyote boots Summer PTs, black socks, subdued PT shoes bedding, toiletries (razor!), socks and underwear, shower shoes + towel notebook + blue & black pen water bottle (disposable is fine) Strongly suggested: IRPG pad lock for your foot locker a wrist watch (cheap black Casio is perfect) SL: PFC Moran ASL: PFC Garcia We have been invited to the National Guard's party: act accordingly Maintain military bearing / customs & courtesies Do not walk around CSLO without a battle buddy I will share a schedule with you on 15DEC. Be flexible when it changes. See links at top of page

fire-knowledge/6-minutes-and-weather.htm.title: 6 Minutes and Weather
fire-knowledge/6-minutes-and-weather.htm.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
fire-knowledge/6-minutes-and-weather.htm.description: Each morning on a wildland crew you should go over the following as a team: Each day has a new topic concerning wildland fire safety which can be covered in about 6 minutes. Objective is to "help firefighting personnel to actively troubleshoot known high risk situations encountered on the fireline". Select your location on the map to get a fire weather forecast for that area For example here's the fire weather for CSLO The forecast labelled "Coastal San Luis Obispo County" is most relevant Lingo: asl = above sea level CWR = Chance of Wetting Rain 20-foot winds = wind that is 20 ft above the fuel (such as tree tops), not necessarily the ground

headers.heading: 6 Minutes for Safety
California Fire Weather

fire-knowledge/irpg.html.title: IRPG
fire-knowledge/irpg.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
fire-knowledge/irpg.html.description:
Everyone should have an Incident Response Pocket Guide (IRPG)Current version (2025) is pink. Older versions are still acceptable.
Cheapest online vendor: Curtis - IRPG, 2025 Edition
Digital version: IRPG App (iOS & Android) -- This is a backup, but not a substitute for your physical IRPG.At the Pre-1C and FF1C courses, you must memorize verbatim the back cover of your IRPG: Keep informed on fire weather conditions and forecasts. Know what your fire is doing at all times. Base all actions on current and expected behavior of the fire. Identify escape routes and safety zones, and make them known. Post lookouts when there is possible danger. Be alert. Keep calm. Think clearly. Act decisively. Maintain prompt communications with your forces, your supervisor, and adjoining forces. Give clear instructions and be sure they are understood. Maintain control of your forces at all times. Fight fire aggressively, having provided for safety first. Fire not scouted and sized up. In country not seen in daylight. Safety zones and escape routes not identified. Unfamiliar with weather and local factors influencing fire behavior. Uninformed on strategy, tactics, and hazards. Instructions and assignments not clear. No communication link with crewmembers or supervisor. Constructing line without safe anchor point. Building fireline downhill with fire below. Attempting frontal assault on fire. Unburned fuel between you and the fire. Cannot see main fire; not in contact with someone who can. On a hillside where rolling material can ignite fuel below. Weather becoming hotter and drier. Wind increases and / or changes direction. Getting frequent spotfires across line. Terrain and fuels make escape to safety zones difficult. Taking a nap near fireline.

headers.heading: 10 Standard Firefighting Orders
18 Watch Out Situations

military-knowledge/army-values-and-gener.title: Army Values and General Orders
military-knowledge/army-values-and-gener.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
military-knowledge/army-values-and-gener.description:
You are expected to have these memorized.
Loyalty
Duty
Respect
Selfless Service
Honor
Integrity
Personal Courage
Notice this spells out the acronym: LDRSHIP(see page 1:1 in the PDF linked above)
I will guard everything within the limits of my post and quit my post only when properly relieved.
I will obey my special orders and perform all my duties in a military manner.
I will report violations of my special orders, emergencies, and anything not covered in my instruction, to the Commander of the Relief.
The General Orders are fixated on guarding a military post. "Special orders" are any other order issued to you, such as drill orders, Emergency State Active Duty (ESAD) orders, etc.

headers.heading: Army Values
Army General Orders

military-knowledge/chain-of-command-expe.title: Chain of Command Expectations
military-knowledge/chain-of-command-expe.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
military-knowledge/chain-of-command-expe.description:
[Related: Chain of Command : Diagram & US Army Ranks and Insignia]Summary: Always communicate with your ASL / SL first. Never jump the Chain of Command. The Open Door Policy exists.Military organizations are strictly hierarchical. Aside from rank, a Service Member is subject to the hierarchy of their "Chain of Command".The "Chain of Command" is a strategy for: distributing orders and information down the hierarchy : "pushing out" orders / information organizing information as it moves up the hierarchy : "pushing up" information The fundamental idea is that you are a "link" in the chain that strictly communicates with the level above (your direct supervisor) and the level below (your direct direct subordinates, if any).A "squad" is a small team of soldiers.As a member of 3rd PLT / 3rd SQD your direct supervisors are the Assistant Squad Leader (ASL) and Squad Leader (SL). Unless explicitly assigned, there is no one below you in the hierarchy.The ASL and SL of the squad are directly responsible for the remaining squad members (you). As a member of the squad, you will most often receive orders from the ASL if not the SL.The orders you receive from the squad-level leadership were likely passed down from platoon-level leadership.A "platoon" is a collection of 2-4 squads.The direct supervisor of a SL is the Platoon Sergeant (PSG). This person is typically a high-ranking Non-Commissioned Officer (NCO).The PSG works closely with the Platoon Leader (PL) who is typically a (commissioned) Officer.The differences between NCOs and Officers are outside the scope of this article. Just know that Officers always outrank NCOs.If you have a question / issue / request, always go through the ASL. If they can't immediately field your inquiry, the ASL will talk with the SL. From there the SL might talk with the PSG and so on.When your SL sends your issue up the Chain of Command, that is called "pushing up" information. For example a 1003 form must be pushed up to the Commanding Officer of RSD for approval.As you move up the Chain of Command, the scope of responsibility at each level expands. A high-level leader doesn't need to know about the specifics of your particular issue. It is up to your direct leadership to distill the information to what is necessary.By going through the ASL & SL, issues can be solved at the lowest level. Perhaps your problem is part of a larger trend that can be solved as a batch. Trust in your direct leadership to digest your situation and present it properly to higher levels of leadership if necessary.Conversely when information is sent down the Chain of Command, that is called "pushing out" information. For example if the SL receives a Fragmentary Order (FRAGO, basically a change of plans) from the PSG, the SL will push out the FRAGO to the squad.Don't do this.Let's say you know high-level leader X has the power to fix your particular issue, so you communicate with that leader directly to get it fixed -- you are wrong.This action undermines your direct leadership by keeping them in the dark about your situation. It also implies that you do not trust your direct leadership or believe them to be incompetent. It is disrespectful to "go around" leaders in your Chain of Command.Furthermore, the nitty-gritty of your particular situation is not the concern of high-level leaders and is likely a waste of their time.Whenever possible, address your issues at the lowest possible level (within our squad).Let's say an issue arises that can't be solved despite your best efforts using the Chain of Command. You always have the option to speak with a high-level leader by invoking their "Open Door Policy".
Per AR-600-20, "an open door policy allows members of the command to present facts, concerns, and problems of a personal or professional nature or other issues that the Soldier has been unable to resolve."I want to emphasize this policy is for issues that you have been "unable to resolve" by normal means. Maybe you feel that your direct leadership is cutting you off from the Chain of Command unfairly. Maybe the issue is directly related to their behavior such that you fear retaliation if you discussed it with them directly -- consider using the Open Door Policy to get help because the Chain of Command is now broken above you.Again, try to resolve problems at the lowest level. Trust your leadership. Only after that fails should you consider using the Open Door Policy.

https://youtu.be/onGybrxXSIs?si=Bj7LLm9aeoPMTT0PThese follow the format of: Preparatory Command - Command of ExecutionLeft - Face Right - Face About - Face
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T0QP6_5Ky4QColumn Left - March
https://youtu.be/emt8dzkU0l4?si=4OZ-5ydb9mvklQGR pivot on your right foot to turn left "march" should be called on the left foot step, allowing you one more step before you pivot on right step Column Right - March

rsd-info-links/arduous-pft-standard.html.description: SourceEspecially for those under 30 years old, this is a tough PT test to pass.PUSH-UPS in 1 minute: Male < 30: 44 Male 30-39: 37 Male 40-49: 29 Female < 30: 27 Female 30-39: 19 Female 40-49: 16 SIT-UPS in 1 minute: Male < 30: 46 Male 30-39: 42 Male 40-49: 37 Female < 30: 42 Female 30-39: 33 Female 40-49: 28 1.5 Mile Run Male 18-39: Under 13:14 Male 40-49: Under 14:25 Female 18-39: Under 15:50 Female 40-49: Under 18:14

rsd-info-links/email-accounts-explained..title: Email Accounts Explained
rsd-info-links/email-accounts-explained..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
rsd-info-links/email-accounts-explained..description:
[Related: Restore Email Account Access] KEY POINTS If you lost access to either account, notify the ASL so we can fix it To maintain access log in every
<90 days for @cmd.ca.gov ‚Üí office.com
<29 days for @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov ‚Üí stateguard.cmd.ca.gov/login2/ Service Members should have access to two email accounts.If you lack access to either, notify your SL.Each account serves different purposes:
This is a state issued Microsoft 365 account. Log in every <90 days to maintain access.
Main purpose = email communication via OutlookThis account also grants you access to:
RSD SharePoint Page Repository of documents for admin / ops / logistics / training
VIPER app Power App for tracking personnel / issued gear / training certs If you get an account access error, reach out to your SL for access. This is a state issued Google account.Log in every <29 days or you will lose access.
Main purpose = GoCSG access. Do not use this account for email communication. GoCSG is a platform for tracking missions and SM profiles / orders. Use it to retrieve your orders for drill. GoCSG will be phased out in the coming months. Archive your certs now. New Service Member? Look for your @cmd.ca.gov password in the inbox of your @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov account Lost access to @cmd.ca.gov ? Has 90 days lapsed since you last logged in? Did you complete the required security training (annual)? Ask for help from the ASL. We need to submit an IT help desk ticket to recover your account. Lost access to @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov ? Has 29 days lapsed since you last logged in? Ask for help from the ASL. We need to email J-6 to recover your account.

ff1c-request.html.title: FF1C Request
ff1c-request.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
ff1c-request.html.description:
This page is a summary of how to request to attend the FF1C and all the required materials you must tackle before you attend. The process is subject to change so read any new instructions you receive carefully. Basic Strategy Request to attend as you are. Don't fret over all the required docs all at once. Submit the online request form now to be considered internally. Be proactive about obtaining all your required materials (online certificates, DMV docs, financial paperwork). Once you're green-lit internally, we can button up loose ends (Letter of Rec from CO) and you should be good to go for a concrete FF1C start date. Sources: old emails JTFR Job Landing Page
üîí JTFR FEMA Course Requirements and Set Up OVERVIEW of requirements by section Submit Request Form (then in no particular order...) Prerequisite Online Courses FEMA Student Identification Number (SID) NFA UID Find and complete courses (5) Driving Docs Defensive Driver‚Äôs Certificate DMV Driver‚Äôs Record Proof of Car Insurance Financial Paperwork In-Processing STD 204 W-4 CSG leadership approval CO Letter of Recommendation Chief Webb approval The online FF1C request form is geared towards Army / Air National Guardsmen. There's stuff that doesn't apply to us (DoD ID, MOS, etc). Either ask what to put or write in "Not Applicable" to get thru the form.Submitting this now will get your name out there. I'd resubmit this every few months because the Task Force tries to run FF1Cs quarterly.
From the JTFR Job Landing Page fill out this form for to request to attend the FF1CThe required online courses were developed by the National Fire Academy (NFA) and National Wildfire Coordinating Group (NWCG)You have to register in two places to access the courses. Obtain FEMA Student Identification Number (SID):
Register for FEMA SID here.
Log in with your SID here to check that it works. Take note of your SID Obtain a FEMA Online User ID (UID):
Register for NFA Online here Scroll down and fill out the registration form (requires your SID) Security Domain = USFA Leave "Organizational Information" blank Submit Retrieve NFA Online User ID from your email Wait an hour before taking a course Find Courses
Log onto FEMA Online here with your UID (not SID ) Click "Home" > "Learning" Use the search bar to find courses Required FEMA Online courses (5) S-190: Introduction to Wildland Fire Behavior L-180: Human Factors in the Wildland Fire Service S-130: Firefighting Training ICS-100: Introduction to the Incident Command System ICS-200: Basic Incident Command System for Initial Response
üí°Good idea to upload your completed certs to VIPER
Proof of Car Insurance Could be a card or downloaded pdf from your insurer
DMV Driver‚Äôs Record Defensive Driver‚Äôs Certificate Can be taken online from a third party for a fee Takes <5h Same as DEC2025 stand down. Please update for 2026.
ESAD In-Processing Packet
W-4 2026
ESAD STD 204
Required only if your address changed: DA Form 3955 Change of Address Formally, you need a Letter of Recommendation from our unit's Commanding Officer We can request this once you are internally accepted to attend the FF1C Use your Chain of Command Informally, you need approval from Chief Webb to be accepted to attend the FF1C Or to put it another way, he has the power to veto your attendance. How do I get approval from Chief Webb?At drill if Chief Webb is leading an FTX or PT test, give your best effort. Demonstrate that you are physically capable. Demonstrate that you are a team-player and are able to look out for yourself and others. Introduce yourself to him and express your interest in becoming a firefighter.By the time you arrive at the FF1C you will have submitted the following 12 docs + requested your letter of rec.PDF only. Please name your files as such: S-190 Lastname_Firstname L-180 Lastname_Firstname S-130 Lastname_Firstname ICS 100 Lastname_Firstname ICS 200 Lastname_Firstname   Proof of Car Insurance Lastname_Firstname  DMV Driver‚Äôs Record Lastname_Firstname   Defensive Drivers Certificate Lastname_Firstname  ESAD Processing Packet Lastname_Firstname  W4 2026 Lastname_Firstname  STD 204 Lastname_Firstname  DA Form 3955 Change of Address Lastname_Firstname Only required if your address changed Don't forget to request your Letter of Recommendation from the CO via CoC!

form-1003.html.title: Form 1003
form-1003.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
form-1003.html.description:
[Related: Chain of Command Expectations & Chain of Command : Diagram]
Download here: Form 1003 (JAN2025)In order to be absent from drill, you must obtain an approved Form 1003. Otherwise you will be considered Absent Without Leave (AWOL üò†).If you are absent for two consecutive drills, you must attend the next drill.The purpose of a Form 1003 is to: document the drill absence and reason determine the duty to be performed in lieu of drill certify that said duty was performed The basic idea is that you cannot simply skip drill. You must perform an approved substitute duty.
Have a wedding to go to? Does it conflict with drill? Check theüîí2025-2026 YTC : PDF and submit a Form 1003 ASAP!For a personal event conflict, expect to be assigned substitute training such as online FEMA courses.Form submission more than 30 days out is the expectation. Last-minute Form 1003s will be heavily scrutinized. Only legitimate emergencies will be considered for approval under 2 weeks before drill. If there is a CSG assignment that conflicts with drill (such as BTC, 1C, a deployment) select "‚òí PRESENT AT ALTERNATE LOCATION" on your Form 1003 and submit for approval.If there is a CSG assignment that does not conflict with drill for the month you can optionally submit a Form 1003 to request drill absence. Mark "‚òí SUTA BEFORE THE DRILL" on your Form 1003 and submit for approval.SUTA = Substitute Unit Training Assembly Talk with your ASL / SL to decide TYPE OF DUTY TO BE PERFORMED ‚ñ° SUTA BEFORE THE DRILL ‚ñ° SUTA AFTER THE DRILL ‚ñ° PRESENT AT ALTERNATE LOCATION ‚ñ° AUTHORIZED ABSENCE (unlikely)
Download Form 1003 (JAN2025) Do not edit the shared copy online ‚ùå Fill out Box 1-8 01JAN2025 (example military date) JTFR-SD CSLO Doe, John (example Lastname, Firstname)
000000000 (use PIV found on GoCSG ‚úÖ ‚Äì do NOT use Social Security # ‚ùå) PFC (example rank) 20JAN2025-21JAN2025 (example substitute duty dates) 24JAN205-26JAN2025 (example drill dates) ‚òí SUTA BEFORE THE DRILL (example substitute duty type) BTC class at Los Alamitos 20JAN2025-21JAN2025 (example authorization description) Email your Form 1003 to the ASL & SL for review and approval. Via your Chain of Command the Platoon Leader (PL) will receive and either approve or deny your Form 1003 (box 8a.) In the case of a personal schedule conflict, this is when the PL will tack on a training assignment for you to complete as your substitute duty. Next the Commanding Officer (CO) will either authorize or reject the PL's approval. Once you have completed the substitute duty, your Form 1003 can be certified (Section III), likely by the Commanding Officer (CO). Certification requires evidence that the substitute duty was completed. Examples of evidence include a course certificate or a PERSTAT (if you were on paid orders). To date (NOV2025) I have never gotten an approved / authorized / certified Form 1003 back. The above is my understanding of how the Form 1003 approval & certification process is supposed to work.Typically "no news is good news" after submitting a Form 1003. When there's an issue it will get kicked back to you quickly.If you are adamant that you need a certified Form 1003 (for example to claim scholarship money), your ASL / SL can help you pursue that. A certified Form 1003 is your proof that you were absent from drill in a legitimate way.

onboarding-reading-list.html.description:
Welcome to 3rd Platoon / 3rd Squad.I created the 3-3 Site to archive information that everyone in 3rd PLT / 3rd SQD should know.Instead of asking you to read everything, first focus on the following list. Please open and read each link:
Email Accounts Explained
üîí 2025-2026 YTC : PDF: This is the drill schedule for the year. Plan accordingly. Requires @cmd.ca.gov access to view.
Chain of Command Expectations

IRPG Reach out to myself (SPC Shoemaker) or the Assistant Squad Leader (ASL) with any questions.Regards,SPC Shoemaker Squad Leader, 3rd PLT / 3rd SQD

restore-email-account-access.html.description:
[Target Audience: SLs assisting their SMs] [Related: Email Accounts Explained]SANITY CHECK: Does the SM have initial login credentials sitting in their @stateguard.ca.gov inbox? Problem solved. Otherwise...SM's lose access in 3 ways: Failed to log in under 90 days Did not complete a required Know54 training Don't know their password. Submit an IT desk ticket on behalf of your SM. This requires that you yourself have @cmd.ca.gov access. Touch base with the SM, they might be assigned a time-sensitive task (24h to do their KnowBe4 training)
Go to the IT Desk Site Department: CSG Issue description copy, fill out their name / email: I have a service member under my chain of command who is locked out of their CMD email account and needs it to be reset. They can not access it to reset their password. Their name is [Firstname Lastname], email is [Firstname.Lastname]@cmd.ca.gov. Submit the ticket Expect a quick turn around on a business day with instructions on what the SM needs to do next via the IT Desk portal and/or your @cmd.ca.gov email.This is a Google / Gmail email account. It really only exists for GoCSG log in. SM's lose access because: Failed to log in under 29 days Don't know their password Request a password reset from S-4, specificlaly 1LT Jones, Valencia. I suggest tasking out your SM to send an email from their Outlook / @cmd.ca.gov email. Draft a formal email requesting access for the @stateguard.cmd.ca.gov email in question.
From Outlook / @cmd.ca.gov account, send email to to 1LT Jones, Valencia: Valencia.Jones@cmd.ca.gov

battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2026-01-02..title: Battle Rhythm 2026-01-02
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2026-01-02..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M6 22a2 2 0 0 1-2-2V4a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h8a2.4 2.4 0 0 1 1.704.706l3.588 3.588A2.4 2.4 0 0 1 20 8v12a2 2 0 0 1-2 2z"></path><path d="M14 2v5a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h5"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2026-01-02..description:
‚òëÔ∏è Complete the fitness survey: CLICK HERE FOR SURVEY
‚òëÔ∏è Finish uploading your certs to VIPER if you haven't Reach out to me if you're still stuck with a technical issue, I will help you out Expect to do a PT test and get taped at JAN2026 drill Wildland firefighting is extremely physically arduous Strength allows you to be both physically capable and resistant to injury Aerobic fitness allows you to keep going and spring back from a hard effort Put those two things together and you will be elite. It takes years to become physically fit at an elite level Best time to start was years ago. 2nd best time to start is now! Don't compare yourself to others. Realistically assess where you're at and track your progress. Consistency is more important than "optimal" training To attempt "optimal" training, you must first define what you want to improve Working out alone can be hard Commit to a training plan Seek guidance from others Find an accountability partner Join a rec league where you have to show up and get to spend time with others Improving fitness consistently requires these three ingredients: Workout Nutrition Recovery Which of these things are you missing? Which could be improved the most? Next drill is 23-25JAN2026 Yes there was talk of going to 4 day drills. That's not happening as of now. 3 day drill per usual
For the most up to date drill dates peep the üîí 2025-2026 YTC : Spreadsheet JAN2026 FF1C is full. Your next shot is in MAY2026 which will lead straight into fire season
Good idea to work on required materials for the FF1C Request now Want a permanent position on a crew? Consider where the stations are located geographically...

battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2026-01-16..title: Battle Rhythm 2026-01-16
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2026-01-16..icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M6 22a2 2 0 0 1-2-2V4a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h8a2.4 2.4 0 0 1 1.704.706l3.588 3.588A2.4 2.4 0 0 1 20 8v12a2 2 0 0 1-2 2z"></path><path d="M14 2v5a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h5"></path></svg>
battle-rhythms/battle-rhythm-2026-01-16..description:
Arrival window is NLT 1430, pleae arrive early 1500 first formation in OCPs Annual "MUSTER" Print and prefill the MUSTER packet that was emailed to your @cmd (9 docs) DO NOT SIGN DO NOT FILL IN HEIGHT / WEIGHT expect to be evaluated by a physician for height / weight Expect a PT test Bring all the PTs you got so you can change out of dirty PTs during the day Orders are up on GoCSG with title RSD JAN2026 IDT Print out per usual Ignore the printed start date for the 22nd. Drill starts on the 23rd. Holiday Party Bring a set of "formal" civilian clothes No alcohol (zero tolerance) JAN 2026 Drill Schedule
Updated YTC (back to 3 day drills but with earlier arrival-time) REQUIRED ‚òëÔ∏è Printed Accession Orders + Drill Orders Set of "formal" civilian clothes for Holiday Party Complete OCP uniform + nametapes / patches / rank insignia Summer PTs (short sleeve shirt and shorts) + Winter PTs (jacket and pants) Bedding, toiletries (razor!), socks and underwear, shower shoes + towel Notebook + blue & black pen Water bottles (at least 2L total, disposable is fine) STRONGLY SUGGESTED IRPG Pad lock for your foot locker Wrist watch (cheap black Casio is perfect) Coyote brown hydration pack + bladder Compass for land nav FTX Questions? Please ask. Dates: 28FEB - 01MAR 2026 Location: City of Norwalk Emergency Operations Center 12700 Norwalk Blvd, Norwalk, CA 90650
Advertisement G-191 and MEMS TTX
Application Form for G-1919 and MEMS TTX Leadership up to the CO needs to give you permission to go Request signatures via your CoC CONTEXT Within the CSG there is a training unit that puts on emergency management trainings
G-191: Emergency Operations Center/Incident Command System Interface What you will learn
MEMS: Military Emergency Management System There's a sick MESMS badge you can earn and wear on you OCPs TTX = Table Top Exercise Basically they will run through an emergency incident scenario I once drove my ass down to Norwalk from the Bay Area to take ICS-300 and it was worth it!
Peep my thoughts on the fitness survey & some ideas on ways to train

fire-knowledge/what-is-jtfr.html.title: What is JTFR
fire-knowledge/what-is-jtfr.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M6 22a2 2 0 0 1-2-2V4a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h8a2.4 2.4 0 0 1 1.704.706l3.588 3.588A2.4 2.4 0 0 1 20 8v12a2 2 0 0 1-2 2z"></path><path d="M14 2v5a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h5"></path></svg>
fire-knowledge/what-is-jtfr.html.description: Organizationally, Joint Task Force Rattlesnake (JTFR) is a cooperative effort between CAL FIRE, a statewide fire department, and the CA National Guard to operate Type 1 wildland handcrews. Separate entities working together is what it means to be a joint task force.CSG units directly support NG units. Therefore the purpose of the CSG's Rattlesnake Support Detachment (RSD) is to support JTFR missions with trained personnel (namely qualified handcrew firefighters and ARRO operators). Geographically, JTFR is composed of 8 separate stations that each run one or more wildland handcrews. There are 4 Northern region stations (Redding / Nevada City, Mendocino / San Jose) and 4 Southern region stations (Fresno, Monterey, Camp Roberts) along with regional C2 locations in Yuba City and Sacramento respectively.As a JTFR handcrew fire figher, you have two sets of leadership: military & CAL FIRE. Each set of leadership has slightly different sets of responsibilities.CAL FIRE company officers that work with Rattlesnake crews are concerned with training and operations as it relates to assigned incidents and fuel mitigation projects. However they are not part of JTFR proper ‚Äì they are employees of CAL FIre.Conversely, you as a military firefighter and a crew's military leadership do not work for CAL FIRE event though CAL FIRE company officers have certain authority over you at specific times.JTFR military personnel work under ESAD orders for the California Military Department. A crew's military leadership is concerned with readiness, discipline and maintenance of standards to meet the needs of the greater JTFR mission: fighting fire safely and effectively with CAL FIRE's support.

fitness/fitness.html.title: Fitness
fitness/fitness.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M6 22a2 2 0 0 1-2-2V4a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h8a2.4 2.4 0 0 1 1.704.706l3.588 3.588A2.4 2.4 0 0 1 20 8v12a2 2 0 0 1-2 2z"></path><path d="M14 2v5a1 1 0 0 0 1 1h5"></path></svg>
fitness/fitness.html.description:
Survey Qs "T/ F: My goal is to pass the 1C in MAY2026" If you answered "no", the unit does not have much to offer you. "Days per week that I train physically (average)" Most of you train 1-2x / week. That's not enough. 3x / week is the minimum. Up to 6x / week is best. Always maintain a rest day. "T/F: I am confident I can pass the minimum PT requirements for the FF1C" Most people were confident they can pass If you're not confident, I suggest focusing on running / hiking / nutritious diet (cut back on processed foods but otherwise don't restrict your diet) "Things that impede me from training are" Top 2 responses were: "life stressors" "lack of adequate sleep" These are real challenges. My tip is to decouple your workout planning from execution ie you have workouts planned out for the entire week and it's as straightforward and time-efficient to execute the workout as possible. Decision fatigue is real. "I most want to improve" Top 3 responses were hiking with a pack injury resistance strength On my crew the best runners are also the best hikers. Running is a way to target aerobic fitness without the wear and tear of hiking with a pack. Compliments strength training nicely as a very different training stimulus. Hiking with a pack is still important to get adapted to carrying weight and spending time on your feet. It gets easier. Try not to break yourself in training. Injury Resistance + Strength go hand in hand. Tight muscles are weak muscles. It's a good idea to mix in mobility work with your strength sessions. To get fit you have to solve 4 problems Planning out your training Doing the training consistently Nutrition Recovery The best I can do for you is to remove some of the burden of planning. It's up to you to take action.Fitness Planning Ideas (in no particular order)
PFC Moran's Fitness and Weight Mgmt West Metro Fire Rescue (random department in Colorado I applied to)
Workout Bank
Nutrition
Tactical Barbell II: Conditioning A book about how to design your own periodized training
Rugged Athlete Free Resources This is a coaching / PT plan platform that I pay for. It's marketed to Wildland Firefighters specifically. I've linked to their free resources

fitness/moran-fitness-and-weight-mgmt.ht.description:
Every meal = Protein + Veggies + WaterExamples:
‚Ä¢	Chicken + broccoli
‚Ä¢	Eggs + spinach
‚Ä¢	Fish + asparagus
‚Ä¢	Steak + salad
‚Ä¢	Greek yogurt + berries‚ùå Avoid for 30 days:
‚Ä¢	Sugary drinks
‚Ä¢	Fast food
‚Ä¢	Bread, tortillas, pasta
‚Ä¢	Chips, sweets
‚Ä¢	Late-night eating (no food after 8pm)üëç What you CAN eat:
‚Ä¢	Meat, eggs, fish
‚Ä¢	Veggies
‚Ä¢	Greek yogurt
‚Ä¢	Fruits (2 servings a day)
‚Ä¢	Nuts (small handful)
‚Ä¢	Rice or potatoes only once per dayThis alone will cut 500‚Äì800 calories daily.You don‚Äôt need extreme workouts. Just do this:Daily (10‚Äì20 min)
‚Ä¢	Fast walk
‚Ä¢	Stair climbing
‚Ä¢	Outdoor walking
OR
‚Ä¢	100 push-ups (broken up)
‚Ä¢	100 body weight squats
‚Ä¢	100 crunches/sit-upsAnything that gets your heart rate up.If you can do gym work:3‚Äì4 days per week
‚Ä¢	30 min treadmill incline walk
‚Ä¢	20 min weights (full body)‚≠ê Drink 80‚Äì100 ounces of water a dayYou‚Äôre already asking about water ‚Äî good sign.
Helps:
‚Ä¢	reduce cravings
‚Ä¢	burn more calories
‚Ä¢	flush out sodium
‚Ä¢	improve energy
Aim for 7 hours minimum.
Sleep controls hunger hormones.
Bad sleep = more cravings + less fat burning.

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
